snippet: When the Canadiens’ Lars Eller was left injured and bloodied by the Senators’ Eric Gryba, it underlined a hypocrisy among fans, announcers and league officials.
abstract: Essay by Paul Brownfield holds that to be a fan of a major contact sport is to be implicated when violence becomes too real; says he looked away from the television during NHL playoff game when Montreal Canadiens' Lars Eller was left injured and bloodied by Ottawa Senators's Eric Gryba, underlining hypocrisy among fans, announcers and league officials.
lead_paragraph: When the Canadiens’ Lars Eller was left injured and bloodied by the Senators’ Eric Gryba, it underlined a hypocrisy among fans, announcers and league officials.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Playoffs — Opening Round Isn’t for Squeamish
headline.main: This Opening Round Isn’t for the Squeamish
headline.print_headline: This Opening Round Isn’t for the Squeamish
